meanings.definition: To strongly encourage or persuade someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: She urged her friend to try the new ice cream flavor.
meanings.sent2: The teacher urged the students to study hard for the upcoming exam.
meanings.sent3: The puppy urged its owner to play fetch by wagging its tail excitedly.
meanings.sent4: The coach urged the team to give their all in the final game of the season.
meanings.sent5: The parent urged their child to always be kind to others.

meanings.definition: To press or push forward with force.
meanings.sent1: The strong wind urged the sailboat forward across the lake.
meanings.sent2: He urged the heavy door open with all his might.
meanings.sent3: The toddler urged the toy car along the floor with a big push.
meanings.sent4: The crowd's cheers urged the marathon runner towards the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The flowing river urged the raft downstream at a rapid pace.

meanings.definition: To advocate or promote something strongly.
meanings.sent1: The environmentalist urged the community to recycle and reduce waste.
meanings.sent2: The celebrity urged their followers to donate to a charitable cause.
meanings.sent3: The chef urged everyone to try the delicious new dish on the menu.
meanings.sent4: The author urged readers to explore the hidden meanings in their novel.
meanings.sent5: The doctor urged patients to prioritize their health and well-being.
